image.altText: A man behind the wheel of a car looks out through the window

props.synopsis: One year ago today, Hamas-led terrorists infiltrated southern Israel from Gaza and went on a rampage. In this oral history, survivors recall the deadliest attack on Jews in a single day since the Holocaust.

title.children: 'I take my pistol and I shoot 11 bullets': Survivors of October 7 remember the worst day of their lives

image.altText: A fireball of smoke and flames over a city scape.

props.synopsis: An Israeli air strike hit a mosque in Gaza with Palestinian officials saying at least 26 people were killed overnight, as the Israeli military continues to attack Gaza and the southern suburbs of Beirut. Follow live.

title.children: IDF air strike kills at least 26 as Gaza mosque hit, while Beirut's suburbs under renewed Israeli bombing

liveBlogKeyEvents.title: Qatar Airways offers special charter flights for repatriating Australians in Lebanon
IDF strikes hospital in central Gaza
WATCH: Footage of moment Hezbollah rockets hit Haifa

image.altText: two men look down as the look through the wreckage of a city building

props.synopsis: In Beirut at night, you hear the constant low-level hum of Israeli drones. Sometimes, when it appears two or three drones hover over a target, the sound reaches a crescendo and a massive explosion often follows. Hezbollah is unable to shoot down any of these drones which present a round-the-clock threat.

title.children: The newest war in the Middle East is an asymmetric one â€“ and Israel is winning

image.altText: A headshot of a man in a suit.

props.synopsis: The Department of Foreign Affairs and Trade says it "makes no apology" for Australia's views on Iran's strikes on Israel, after Iranian state reported the Australian ambassador had been summoned by Tehran.

title.children: 'Australia makes no apology': Government hits back after Australian ambassador summoned by Iran

image.altText: Two screens display texts sent by a scammer looking for a person named Anthony.

props.synopsis: Scammers are targeting Australians in offshore call centres as they're seen as "easy prey", according to a young migrant who used to work in an Ukrainian call centre.

title.children: Australians are being targeted by overseas scammers who see them as 'easy prey'

image.altText: A woman, leaning on the outside wall of her house, looks at the camera with a slight smile.

props.synopsis: As Australia considers the possibility of a nuclear-powered future, the US gives us insights into what does, and doesn't, work.

title.children: Peter Dutton has promised Australia a nuclear future. In the US, this resident says her power bills are higher than ever

image.altText: A blurry image of a boat sinking

props.synopsis: A Samoan man said oil from the sunk HMNZS Manawanui was identifiable along the coast for several kilometres which would have a "massive impact".

title.children: Fears of 'crazy' environmental impact after NZ naval ship sinks off Samoa's south

image.altText: High density housing in suburban Sydney.

props.synopsis: Filling millions of spare bedrooms could help ease rental and cost of living pressures for vulnerable Australians in the short term, new research suggests.

title.children: Older Australians could rent out spare rooms to help ease the housing crisis, new research suggests

image.altText: Kamala Harris sitting at a table with her hands folded, looking to her right.

props.synopsis: The US vice-president opened a media blitz by the Democratic ticket on Sunday by appearing on the Call Her Daddy podcast hosted by Alex Cooper.

title.children: 'It's really important for women to lift each other up': Kamala Harris rejects JD Vance 'childless cat ladies' dig in rare interview

image.altText: A woman cries and leans on a body that is covered with the Israeli flag.

props.synopsis: October 7 was not just another wave of Middle East violence; it was a massacre and kidnapping so unconscionable and cruel it has radically changed everything. But as we mark this day, a deal for peace seems further away than ever.

title.children: If communities mourn their own losses without recognising the other's suffering, the divide is unlikely to be bridged

image.altText: Jack Howarth lies under Panthers players as Storm players celebrate

props.synopsis: Cameron Munster's season ends with allegations he bit a Panther, while the Bunker supported a no-try decision but Melbourne believed footage showed the ball on the ground. Here are the quick hits from the 2024 NRL grand final.

title.children: Grand final quick hits: NRL says bunker made correct call on disallowed try, as Melbourne star is accused of biting

image.altText: A stock trader looks down at a tablet as he works on the floor of a busy stock exchange while surrounded by screens.

props.synopsis: Surprisingly robust US jobs data drove Wall Street higher on Friday and that momentum has flowed through to the ASX which is up 0.5pc heading into the afternoon session. Follow the day's events and insights from our business reporters on the ABC News live markets blog. Â

title.children: ASX gains 0.5pc after surprise US job data sent Wall Street higher, Rio Tinto confirms takeover bid of lithium miner

liveBlogKeyEvents.title: Mineral and energy prices will continue to fall: NAB

image.altText: Australia captain James Tedesco sitting next to coach Mal Meninga, both smiling during a press conference

props.synopsis: James Tedesco's non-selection comes after he lost the NSW State of Origin captaincy earlier this year, with his Blues replacement at fullback, Dylan Edwards, picked in Mal Meninga's squad.

title.children: Dally M medallist snubbed and captain dropped as Jillaroos and Kangaroos name Test squads

image.altText: A bald man concentrates while he scales a rock face

props.synopsis: Gus Taylor's long climb back after amputation and an accidental death.

title.children: 'It was a freak accident': How Gus Taylor learnt to forgive himself after his friend's death

image.altText: A couple looking at a photo album

props.synopsis: As the one-year anniversary of Hamas's devastating terror attack on Israel arrives, members of Australia's Jewish community are coming together to commemorate and remember those killed.

title.children: In her Melbourne home, this woman's wedding album is filled with the faces of friends lost a year ago

image.altText: A close up image of a man with blond hair in a suit.

props.synopsis: The Apprentice tells the story of Donald Trump and late mentor Roy Cohn as the former US president climbed to the top of the real estate ladder in 1980s New York City.

title.children: Donald Trump didn't want this film released before the US election â€” and it's been a lightning rod for controversy

image.altText: A woman with grey hair sits in a chair in a house, looking out the window.

props.synopsis: Federal Financial Services Minister Stephen Jones says he wants to stamp out bad behaviour by retirement village operators following an ABC investigation that revealed "legalised financial abuse of the elderly" is rife.Â

title.children: Retirement villages put on notice after being accused of gouging older Australians in 'corporatised elder abuse'

image.altText: Bailey Smith of Western Bulldogs during the AFL Round 12 match.

props.synopsis: Geelong will have its work cut out if it is to assemble its dream midfield by bringing in the star duo of Bailey Smith and Clayton Oliver next season. Follow live as the trade period gets underway.

title.children: Geelong facing uphill battle as clubs dig in on Bailey Smith and Clayton Oliver

liveBlogKeyEvents.title: OFFICIAL: Jack Darling traded to North Melbourne
OFFICIAL: Alex Neal-Bullen traded to Adelaide
Bulldogs talking tough on Bailey Smith and Jack Macrae

image.altText: flowers and a candles on a sidewalk. Police tape running through a peace sign made of metals.

props.synopsis: Police remain on the scene of a residential fire east of Brisbane that killed an eight-year-old girl, with grave fears for a 31-year-old woman who was babysitting the child at the time.

title.children: 'Grave concerns' for missing babysitter after Thorneside fire that claimed the life of eight-year-old girl

image.altText: John Pesutto appears serious, standing inside Parliament in front of a bookshelf.

props.synopsis: Pressure is mounting on the Victorian Liberal leader, with a group of MPs planning a leadership contest as the Moira Deeming defamation case looms over the party.

title.children: Victorian Liberal MPs planning to oust leader John Pesutto 'before Christmas'

image.altText: A young Christopher Ciccone and Madonna smile for photographers at a red carpet event

props.synopsis: Ciccone worked closely with his superstar sister as a dancer and creative, before releasing a tell-all book about his life with her in 2008.Â

title.children: Christopher Ciccone, Madonna's 'visionary' brother, dies aged 63

image.altText: a man in a suit with the photo showing his side profile

props.synopsis: David Speirs has announced he intends to quit parliament and pause his Liberal party membership, with police saying he has also been charged. What does this mean for his future and the electorate he represents?

title.children: From SA Liberal leader to arrest, how did it all unfold?

image.altText: Karl Vilips driving the golf ball, wearing a red cap and white shirt

props.synopsis: Two of Australia's most promising golfing talents have arrived on the sport's biggest tours, earning promotion on the same day.

title.children: Aussie young guns qualify for major US golf tours on the same day

image.altText: A man walking with cows.

props.synopsis: An increasing number of Chinese youths fed up with the pressures and values of urban life are moving to China's vast countryside and transforming it in their own ways.Â

title.children: 'People realise you don't have to work at a desk': China's young people are heading for the hills

image.altText: A small snail with a shell on its back with a swirl. It is sitting on a dark log.

props.synopsis: A critically endangered gastropod has caused two Queensland government projects, including the Nathan Dam development first proposed in the 1920s, to move at a snail's pace.

title.children: Snail brings billion-dollar dam, town's new footpath to a standstill

image.altText: Jacquie Kelly hero image SINGLE USE ONLY DO NOT USE

props.synopsis: A Victorian landcare group has filed legal proceedings against the federal government, challenging the approval of the Nyah flood plain project, alleging it is a "dodgy water offset project" that is environmentally damaging.

title.children: Community group launches legal action to protect Murray River flood plains in 'Kakadu of the south'

image.altText: A bishop in full robes.

props.synopsis: Melbourne-based Ukrainian bishop Mykola Bychok will become the first Australian-based cardinal since the death of George Pell. He was among 21 new cardinals announced by Pope Francis on Sunday in Rome.

title.children: Melbourne bishop chosen by Pope Francis to become a cardinal

image.altText: Wine being put in a glass

props.synopsis: In the first visit by Chinese delegates since trade tariffs were lifted in April, West Australian wineries are showcasing their premium wines to big buyers in the hopes of landing lucrative contracts.

title.children: WA wineries plan to deal with China differently since tariffs lifted in April

image.altText: A male artist with bleached blonde hair and beanie sits on couch with large green octopus toy and holds his artworks

props.synopsis: Dyscalculia, which Alfie Barker describes as being like "dyslexia but for maths", receives only a fraction of the research funding its literacy counterpart does, and experts believe that needs to change.

title.children: When you suffer from dyscalculia â€” like 'dyslexia but for maths' â€” even driving can be off limits

image.altText: GettyImages-2177114628

props.synopsis: Australian manager Ange Postecoglou says he is 'absolutely gutted' after Tottenham gave up a halftime lead to lose to Brighton in the EPL.

title.children: 'Absolutely gutted': Postecoglou cuts a dejected figure as Spurs capitulate to Brighton in EPL

image.altText: Two go karts racing on a dirt track

props.synopsis: Racers and spectators flock to South Australia's south-east to compete in the Australian Dirt Kart Titles, with organisers saying the sport is a relatively affordable way to get into motor racing.

title.children: Australian Dirt Kart Titles organisers say sport is growing as grassroots introduction for juniors
